item.title: Cuisine) Or As
item.content:
It is named for the city of Cayenne in French Guiana

The fruits are generally dried and ground, or pulped and baked into cakes, which are then ground and sifted to make the powdered spice of the same name

  • Eaten Is
  • Maturity, Maturity,
  • Colored Colored
  • Eaten Maturity,

The fruits are generally dried and ground, or pulped and baked into cakes, which are then ground and sifted to make the powdered spice of the same name

It is also used as an herbal supplement, and was mentioned by Nicholas Culpeper in his Complete Herbal, 1653, as 'guinea pepper'[3] a misnomer for 'guiana pepper'

It is a cultivar of Capsicum annuum related to bell peppers, jalapeños, paprika and othersThe Capsicum genus is in the nightshade family (Solanaceae)

item.language: Cayenne is used in cooking spicy dishes, as a powder or in its whole form (such as in Korean, Sichuan and other Asian cuisine), or in a thin, vinegar-based sauce
item.tagline:
It is generally rated at 30,000 to 50,000 Scoville units

The Capsicum genus is in the nightshade family (Solanaceae)
